title: American_Top_40_1978_June_17th
description:
"You're hearing the hottest hits in the USA as the countdown goes on."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown I recorded last year and got no extras:

This is the first countdown in nine months with no recording by the Bee Gees, but they did write three of the songs in the countdown.

A listener wants to know who has had the biggest hit of a remake that the artist had already hit with before. Casey says there is a tie between two different acts, and gives the details.

Casey tells how one artist in the countdown got into a fight with Buford Pusser, the real life Sheriff whose story was told in the 1973 film, "Walking Tall."

Another listener wants to know who has had the most songs on the chart at the same time and in the top 10 at the same time. Casey says there is a four-way tie for most songs in the top 10, and declares the Beatles to have had the most songs on the chart simultaneously.

There is a song by an artist whose album stayed on the album chart for nine and a half years.

There is a song by only the third artist in chart history to have his first 10 singles hit the top 40.

Casey answers the question, "Has there ever been a top 10 hit in the rock era by a family act which included the mother and the father?" Casey says no but tells of a mother and her kids as well as a father and his three daughters who did hit.
